00160     public: virtual inline void setPacketType (PacketType t) {
00161       if (t != PacketType_Context) {
00162         throw VRTException("Can not change packet type to non-Context type when using BasicContextPacket");
00163       }
00164       BasicVRTPacket::setPacketType(t);
00165     }

00185     // XXX - overriding public: virtual bool BasicVRTPacket::isChangePacket () const
00186     //       since that is hard-coded to return true (valid for Data packets), but here we get that
00187     //       value from inline bool IndicatorFieldProvider::isChangePacket() const;
00188     public: virtual bool isChangePacket() const {
00189       return IndicatorFieldProvider::isChangePacket();
00190     }

00205     // FIXME - this is probably incorrect. The spec says timestamp adjustment applies
00206     //         to the timestamp of each associated data packet, and NOT to the timestamp
00207     //         of the context packet. That means this function is impossible to ever
00208     //         return valid without access to a DataPacket and ContextPacket together.
00209     //         See Section 9.7.3.1 of V49.2 draft spec
00210     public: TimeStamp getAdjustedTimeStamp () const {
00211       int64_t adj = getTimeStampAdjustment();
00212       return (adj == INT64_NULL)? getTimeStamp() : getTimeStamp().addPicoSeconds(adj);
00213     }

00304     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField0 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00305       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00306       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength());
00307     }
00308     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField1 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00309       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00310       if (!isCIF1Enable()) return INT32_NULL;
00311       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength()+4);
00312     }
00313     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField2 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00314       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00315       if (!isCIF2Enable()) return INT32_NULL;
00316       int32_t off = 0;
00317       if (isCIF1Enable()) off+=4;
00318       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength()+4+off);
00319     }
00320     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField3 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00321       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00322       if (!isCIF3Enable()) return INT32_NULL;
00323       int32_t off = 0;
00324       if (isCIF1Enable()) off+=4;
00325       if (isCIF2Enable()) off+=4;
00326       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength()+4+off);
00327     }
00328     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField7 (bool occurrence=0) const {
00329       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
00330       if (!isCIF7Enable()) return INT32_NULL;
00331       int32_t off = 0;
00332       if (isCIF1Enable()) off+=4;
00333       if (isCIF2Enable()) off+=4;
00334       if (isCIF3Enable()) off+=4;
00335       return VRTMath::unpackInt(bbuf, getPrologueLength()+4+off);
00336     }

00374     protected: inline Geolocation getGeolocation (int8_t cifNum, int32_t field) const {
00375       int32_t     off = getOffset(cifNum, field);
00376       Geolocation val;
00377       if (off >= 0) unpackPayloadRecord(off,val);
00378       return val;
00379     }

00383       int32_t     off = getOffset(cifNum, field);
00384       Ephemeris val;
00385       if (off >= 0) unpackPayloadRecord(off,val);
00386       return val;

00397     public: inline GeoSentences getGeoSentences () const {
00398       //int32_t      off = IndicatorFieldProvider::getOffset(GPS_ASCII);
00399       int32_t      off = getOffset(0, protected_CIF0::GPS_ASCII_mask);
00400       GeoSentences val;
00401       if (off >= 0) unpackPayloadRecord(off,val);
00402       return val;
00403     }

00487     public: inline PayloadFormat getDataPayloadFormat () const {
00488       // INT64_NULL (0x8000000000000000) is actually a valid PayloadFormat bit arrangement, so we
00489       // can't use the normal isNull(bits) check. This isn't an issue in Java where null is
00490       // not equal to a legal 64-bit integer value.
00491       return (getOffset(0, protected_CIF0::DATA_FORMAT_mask) < 0)? PayloadFormat() // NULL
00492                                                                  : PayloadFormat(getX(0, protected_CIF0::DATA_FORMAT_mask));
00493     }
00494 
00499     public: inline void setDataPayloadFormat (const PayloadFormat &val) {
00500       setX(0, protected_CIF0::DATA_FORMAT_mask, val.getBits());
00501     }
